Here's an example of how you can set up your spreadsheet:

**Expense Tracker**

**Categories**

| Category | Date | Description | Amount |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Gifts |  |  |  |
| Charitable Giving |  |  |  |

**Gifts**

| Date | Description | Amount |
| --- | --- | --- |
| [Date of sister's birthday] | Silver necklace with tiny pendant for sister's 25th birthday | $40 |
| [Date of baby shower] | Baby onesie and baby blocks for colleague's wife's baby shower | $20 |

**Charitable Giving**

| Date | Description | Amount |
| --- | --- | --- |
| [Date of grocery purchase] | Groceries for Mrs. Johnson | [Insert amount] |

You can add more columns or rows as needed, but this should give you a good starting point.

To add the costs of the gifts, simply fill in the dates, descriptions, and amounts in the **Gifts** section. For the Charitable Giving category, you can log the date, description, and amount of the groceries you purchased for Mrs. Johnson.

Remember to update your spreadsheet regularly to keep track of your expenses and stay organized!

Tips:

* Consider setting up separate columns for the category total, so you can easily calculate the total amount spent in each category.
* You can also add a "Running Total" column to keep track of your overall expenses.
* If you want to get more detailed, you can create subcategories within each category (e.g., "Birthdays" and "Baby Showers" under **Gifts**).
* Don't forget to save your spreadsheet regularly, and consider setting up automatic backups to ensure your data is safe.
